pacman.controllers

Class Controller<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.controllers.Controller<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of the move to be returned (either a single move for Ms Pac-Man or an EnumMap for the ghosts).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggressiveGhosts, BFS_Controller, DFS_Controller, HumanController, Legacy, Legacy2TheReckoning, MyGhosts, MyPacMan, NearestPillPacMan, NearestPillPacManVS, RandomGhosts, RandomNonRevPacMan, RandomPacMan, StarterGhosts, StarterPacMan

    public abstract class Controller<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is the superclass of your controller. In contains the code required to run the controller as a thread. In provides numerous methods that allow the Executor to use the controller in various different execution modes. Your controller only needs to provide the code for the getMove() method.

      This method is used to check whether the controller computed a move since the last update of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Instantiates a new controller. The constructor initialises the class variables.

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public final void terminate()
        Terminates the controller: a signal is sent and the flag 'alive' is set to false. When the thread wakes up, the outer loop will terminate and the thread finishes.

      • update

        public final void update(Game game,
                         long timeDue)
        Updates the game state: a copy of the game is passed to this method and the class variable is updated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        game - A copy of the current game
        timeDue - The time the next move is due

      • getMove

        public final T getMove()
        Retrieves the move from the controller (whatever is stored in the class variable).
        Returns:
        The move stored in the class variable 'lastMove'

      • run

        public final void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • hasComputed

        public final boolean hasComputed()
        This method is used to check whether the controller computed a move since the last update of the game.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the controller computed a move since the last update

      • getMove

        public abstract T getMove(Game game,
                          long timeDue)
        Compute the next move given a copy of the current game and a time the move has to be computed by. This is the method contestants need to implement. Many examples are available in pacman.controllers.examples Your controllers must be in the files: pacman.entries.pacman.MyPacMan.java for Pac-Man controllers or pacman.entries.ghosts.MyGhosts.java for ghosts controllers.
        Parameters:
        game - A copy of the current game
        timeDue - The time the next move is due
        Returns:
        The move to be played (i.e., the move calculated by your controller)
